intro: Rytigynia mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbensis rytigynia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on plant diversity and conservation in equatorial regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
